meanings.definition: The aft-most mast on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors climbed the mizzenmast to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to secure the sails to the mizzenmast.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the mizzenmast, pretending to be the lookout.
meanings.sent4: The mizzenmast stood tall like a guardian at the back of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The creaking of the mizzenmast echoed through the quiet night.

meanings.definition: The mast immediately aft of the mainmast on a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The flag fluttered proudly from the mizzenmast as the ship sailed on.
meanings.sent2: The crew gathered around the mizzenmast for a group photo.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor tied a prank flag to the mizzenmast, causing laughter among the crew.
meanings.sent4: The shadows danced around the mizzenmast in the light of the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The mizzenmast swayed gently with the rhythm of the waves.
